div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2349 Azaila, 50 km. SE of Saragossa, 1920 Burial: c. 79 B.C. (Cabré) Contents: 4 AR, 736 AE. Two hoards now conflated, from excavations Carmo: 1 AE Corduba: 1 AE Valentia: 1 AE Ebusus: 1 AE (as Vives MH, pl. LXXX) Iberian: 4 AR 716 AE Massalia: 1 AE (as CMG 1673) Carthage: 1 AE (as SNGCop. 109) Roman Rep.: 11 AE Unc.: 2 AE Disposition: Madrid † Cabré Aguilo, MNE 1921, no. 2, pp. 25-33, illus. Beltran y Villagrasa, BASE 2 (1945), pp. 135-79 Beltran Martinez, Caesaraugusta 23-4 (1964), pp. 79-86 Untermann, MM 1964, p. 121 Crawford, RRCH 220 † Navascues, Las monedas hispanicas del Museo Arqueológico Nacional de Madrid II (Barce- lona, 1971), pp. 37-56, illus. Ramagosa, Acta NUM 1971, pp. 79-81
